info.title: The Selling Partner API for Amazon External Fulfillment Return Item Processing
info.description: You can use the Amazon External Fulfillment Return Item Processing API to retrieve, track, and process return items through Amazon's External Fulfillment returns management system.

get.description: Retrieve a list of return items. You can filter results by location, RMA ID, status, or time.

parameters.name: returnLocationId
parameters.description: The SmartConnect location ID of the location from which you want to retrieve return items.

parameters.name: rmaId
parameters.description: The RMA ID of the return items you want to list.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of return items you want to list. You can retrieve all new return items with the `CREATED` status.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The return is created and is awaiting pickup.
The carrier is notified to pick up the return from the customer.
The carrier is out for pickup from the customer.
The customer cancelled the pickup request.
The customer rescheduled the pickup.
The return is picked up from the customer.
The return is in transit to the fulfillment location.
The return is out for delivery to the fulfillment location.
The return is delivered to the fulfillment location.
The return delivery is replanned.
The customer dropped off the return at a designated location.
The return is partially processed.
The return is fully processed.
The return is rejected.
The return is cancelled.

parameters.name: reverseTrackingId
parameters.description: The reverse tracking ID of the return items you want to list.

parameters.name: createdSince
parameters.description: Return items created after the specified date are included in the response. In [ISO 8601](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/iso-8601) date-time format.

parameters.name: createdUntil
parameters.description: Return items created before the specified date are included in the response. In [ISO 8601](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/iso-8601) date-time format.

parameters.name: lastUpdatedSince
parameters.description: Return items updated after the specified date are included in the response. In [ISO 8601](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/iso-8601) date-time format. If you supply this parameter, you must also supply `returnLocationId` and `status`.

parameters.name: lastUpdatedUntil
parameters.description: Return items whose most recent update is before the specified date are included in the response. In [ISO 8601](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/iso-8601) date-time format. If you supply this parameter, you must also supply `returnLocationId` and `status`.

parameters.name: maxResults
parameters.description:
The number of return items you want to include in the response.

**Default:** 10

**Maximum:** 100

parameters.name: nextToken
parameters.description: A token that you use to retrieve the next page of results. The response includes `nextToken` when there are multiple pages of results. To get the next page of results, call the operation with this token and include the same arguments as the call that produced the token. To get a complete list, call this operation until `nextToken` is null. Note that this operation can return empty pages.

200.description: Success. The response contains a list of return items.

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

400.description: Request has missing or invalid parameters and cannot be parsed.

x-amzn-RateLimit-Limit.description: Your rate limit (requests per second) for this operation.

errors.message: LastUpdatedAfter value is an not a valid ISO date/time object.

403.description: Indicates that access to the resource is forbidden. Possible reasons include Access Denied, Unauthorized, Expired Token, or Invalid Signature.

404.description: The resource specified does not exist.

409.description: The resource specified conflicts with the current state

413.description: The request size exceeded the maximum accepted size.

415.description: The request payload is in an unsupported format.

429.description: The frequency of requests was greater than allowed.

errors.message: Temporary failure occurred, retry operation after some time.

500.description: An unexpected condition occurred that prevented the server from fulfilling the request.

errors.message: Internal failure occurred, contact Amazon support

503.description: Temporary overloading or maintenance of the server.

get.description: Retrieve the return item with the specified ID.

parameters.name: returnId
parameters.description: The ID of the return item you want.

ErrorList.description: An object containing a list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

errors.description: A list of error responses returned when a request is unsuccessful.

Error.description: Error response returned when the request is unsuccessful.

code.description: An error code that identifies the type of error that occurred.

message.description: A message that describes the error condition.

details.description: Additional details that can help the caller understand or fix the issue.
details.example: The specified parameter value is invalid.

returnLocationId.description: The SmartConnect identifier for where the return item was dropped for delivery.

merchantSku.description: The seller's identifier for the SKU.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: A return initiated by the customer.
A rejected return.
A standard return where the customer returns the item.
A return where the customer receives a replacement item.
A return where the customer exchanges the item for a different one.

numberOfUnits.description: The total number of units in the return.

status.description: The current status of the return.

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The return is created and awaiting pickup.
The carrier is notified to pick up the return from the customer.
The carrier is out for pickup from the customer.
The customer cancelled the pickup request.
The customer rescheduled the pickup.
The return is picked up from the customer.
The return is in transit to the fulfillment location.
The return is out for delivery to the fulfillment location.
The return is delivered to the fulfillment location.
The return delivery is replanned.
The customer dropped off the return at a designated location.
The return is partially processed.
The return is fully processed.
The return is rejected.
The return is cancelled.

fulfillmentLocationId.description: The ID of the location that fulfilled the order.

creationDateTime.description: The date and time when the return was created.

lastUpdatedDateTime.description: The date and time of the most recent update to the return.

returnShippingInfo.description: Information about the shipping of the return packages.

marketplaceChannelDetails.description: Channel-specific attributes for the return. These attributes are not mandatory and each channel can provide them differently.

otpDetails.description: The one-time password (OTP) details of the return item.

packageDeliveryMode.description: The package delivery mode. This indicates whether the return was delivered to the seller with or without a one-time password (OTP).

x-docgen-enum-table-extension.description: The return package was delivered to the seller with OTP verification.
The return package was delivered to the seller without OTP verification.

carrierName.description: The name of the third party courier service used to ship the return package.

trackingId.description: The tracking ID of the return package.

OtpDetails.description: One-time password (OTP) details of the return item.

otp.description: One-time password to validate the return delivered to the seller.

validTill.description: The UNIX timestamp of when the verification code expires.

channelName.description: The name of the channel within the marketplace.

MarketplaceChannelDetails.description: Marketplace channel-specific attributes for the return. These attributes are not mandatory and each channel can provide them differently.

merchantId.description: The ID of the merchant or seller to whom this return is created in the marketplace.

returnLocationId.description: The Amazon SmartConnect ID of the location to which this return is created.

channelSku.description: The Amazon SmartConnect SKU of the channel.

exchangeOrderId.description: The Amazon SmartConnect ID of the exchange order.

ReplanningDetails.description: Provides details about the replanned returns.

previousTrackingInfo.description: A list of all the previous tracking information for the return.

InvoiceInformation.description: Invoice-related information for the return created for Amazon SmartConnect.

id.description: The unique ID of the invoice that corresponds to the return.

rmaId.description: The RMA ID of the return.

fulfillmentOrderId.description: The SmartConnect ID of the fulfillment order for which the return was placed.

ReturnShippingInfo.description: Information about the shipping of the return packages.

deliveryDateTime.description: The date and time when the seller received the return.

pickupDateTime.description: The date and time when the return was picked up.

DateTime.description: A date and time in [ISO 8601](https://developer-docs.amazon.com/sp-api/docs/iso-8601) format.

nextToken.description: A token that you use to retrieve the next page of results. The response includes `nextToken` when there are multiple pages of results. To get the next page of results, call the operation with this token and include the same arguments as the call that produced the token. To get a complete list, call this operation until `nextToken` is null. Note that this operation can return empty pages.
